title: Best toners for dry skin: 7 top choices to keep your skin hydrated | HealthShots
text: Toner is a vital skin care product that helps to maintain the pH balance of your skin and keep it hydrated from within. But choosing the right toner according to the skin type becomes essential for enhancing its effectiveness. Dry skin requires a toner that is infused with hydrating ingredients to maintain the water level in the skin as this skin type loses water too quickly. This water-based tonic contains hyaluronic acid, salicylic acid and other ingredients which can work together to moisturise your skin, reduce the appearance of pores and restore the natural pH balance of your skin. It also prepares your skin for absorbing serums, moisturisers and other skin care products. We have curated a list of the best toners for dry skin that can calm, revitalise your skin and make it feel refreshed. 7 best toners for dry skin Check out this list of the best toners for dry skin in India and restore your skin health: 1. Plum Bulgarian Valley Rose Water Toner Plum Bulgarian Valley Rose Water Toner can add a rosy touch to your skincare routine. Packed with the goodness of hyaluronic acid, Bulgarian rose extract and witch hazel, this toner for dry skin promises to hydrate your skin and give it a plump look. It may also soothe and calm inflammation, redness and discomfort. Regular use of this toner can tighten the pores, moisturise your skin, reduce dryness and leave your skin feeling refreshed. The brand also claims that this product is free from parabens, phthalates and cruelty. B093CNS6G1 Also Read: 5 best toners for combination skin you need to try 2. Dot & Key Rice Water Hydrating Toner Dot & Key Rice Water Hydrating Toner promises to maintain the hydration level of your skin. Enriched with the goodness of hyaluronic acid, lactic acid, probiotic chemistry and Japanese rice water, this skin care product for dry skin can gently exfoliate your skin to unclog pores and refine the appearance of the pores. It may even contribute to the development of good bacteria in the skin to balance the skin microbiome level. The presence of natural soothing agents in this product may help calm redness and skin irritation. This toner has a lightweight, watery texture that can absorb quickly into the skin. The brand also states that this product is alcohol free, which makes it safe for the skin. B09RWQ54C5 3. Good Vibes Tender Nourishing Toner Good Vibes Tender Nourishing Toner is loaded with the goodness of coconut that can provide intense hydration to your skin. This toner promises to make your skin feel refreshed without drying it out. It also claims to strengthen the skin barrier function, restore and maintain the pH levels of your skin. Regular use of this toner may keep your skin protected from damage, reduce roughness, provide nourishment and make your skin soft. Infused with vitamins and antioxidants, this toner can clean the pores, tighten them and give you a youthful looking skin. The brand also states that its product is free from alcohol, parabens, sulphates, minerals and cruelty. B09NW94YY7 4. CeraVe Hydrating Toner CeraVe Hydrating Toner contains hyaluronic acid and niacinamide that helps you to hydrate your skin and lock in moisture. This pH balanced toner promises to remove impurities from your skin and leave it feeling refreshed. Free from alcohol, this toner may make your skin smooth, soft and clean. It has a non-drying formula which makes it perfect for dry skin. It may also enhance the natural skin barrier function and restore its health. The brand also claims that its dermatologically-tested product is free from fragrance and allergen. B09LKXR62L 5. Thayer Witch Hazel Toner Thayer Witch Hazel Toner contains cucumber extract, aloe vera and witch hazel. This toner promises to retain the moisture level of your skin, making it nourished and fresh. Ideal for cleansing and toning, this product contains antioxidants that can diminish clogged pores and tighten them. Made from skin-friendly and organic ingredients, this toner can provide a cooling sensation to your skin, reduce puffiness, fade dark circles, blemishes and scars. B007HD570Q Health Shots Recommends: 5 best toners for every skin type to boost skin hydration 6. Laneige Water Bank Blue Hyaluronic Essence Toner Laneige Water Bank Blue Hyaluronic Essence Toner is enriched with the goodness of beta glucan, probiotic and panthenol. This product promises to lock in moisture and prevent moisture loss. It can also help in recovery of your skin by strengthening the barrier function. This toner promises to provide an instant soothing effect to your skin. By replenishing the moisture level, it can improve the texture of your skin and prevent dry patches. B09TH11Z7F 7. Coxir Ultra Hyaluronic Toner Coxir Ultra Hyaluronic Toner is infused with hyaluronic acid, allantoin and 19 plant extracts. Regular use of this toner can intensively hydrate and moisturise your skin. It also promises to soothe your skin and promote the regeneration process. This skin care product can also improve the elasticity, texture and tone of your skin. The brand states that its product can prevent pigmentation, dull spots and give instant relief from dryness. B07P88BHVS What are the benefits of toners for dry skin? Balances your skin’s pH balance: After cleansing your face, the outer layer of the skin may feel dry. By using toners, you can restore the balance to your skin, making it feel soft and smooth. Hydrates your skin: The presence of hydrating ingredients like hyaluronic acid, rose water, glycerin and more in toners can hydrate your skin from within and give a long-lasting result. Refreshes your skin: By applying toner on your face, you can make your skin feel fresh and revitalised. Soothe your skin: Formulated using botanical extracts that are rich in anti-inflammatory properties, facial toners can provide relief from redness, discomfort and skin irritation. Prevent acne breakouts: Cleansing is not enough to remove the impurities and product build ups from your skin. By using toners on a regular basis, you can remove excess oil, dirt and other impurities from your skin that can lead to acne breakouts. Also Read: 5 best tea tree toners that will help you get rid of acne in no time How to choose the right toner for dry skin? Consider the following points while choosing the right toner for your skin: Look for toners that contain active ingredients like hyaluronic acid, glycerin, botanical extracts, aloe vera and ceramides. These ingredients can deeply hydrate your skin, lock in moisture, prevent dryness, soothe and calm your skin. Avoid buying products that contain harmful chemicals, alcohol and other toxic material which can enhance the dryness and cause irritation. Opt for toners that are labelled as “hydrating” and “moisturising” to make sure that it restores the lost water level in your skin. Go for toners that have a lightweight texture, fast-absorbing and non-comedogenic formula to ensure that it can absorb quickly into the skin without clogging pores. Perform a patch test before applying the toner on your face to ensure that it doesn’t have any adverse effects. Frequently asked questions (FAQs) Are toners good for dry skin? Dry skin is prone to moisture loss. So toners that are formulated with hydrating ingredients can maintain and restore the water level in this skin type. As per a study published in the National Library of Medicine (NIH), consistent use of toners can improve the hydration level of your skin. Is rosewater toner good for dry skin? According to a study published in Journal of Xi’an Shiyou University, rose water can improve the hydration level and appearance of the skin. Regular use of rose water toner can add glow to the skin and maintain its overall health. What ingredients to look for in a toner? A toner is a water-based skin care product that helps maintain the pH balance of the skin, clean the skin and reduce the appearance of pores. A good toner must contain hydrating ingredients like hyaluronic acid, distilled water, rose water, aloe vera, cucumber juice, lemongrass extract and peppermint as per the International Journal of Advanced Research in Science, Communication and Technology (IJARSCT).
